action_list.description: System action for creating an application

attrs.script:
#!/bin/sh

# set the VM's hostname
sudo hostnamectl set-hostname @@{MANAGEMENT_HOSTNAME}@@

# make sure all packages are upgraded to the latest versions
sudo yum -y update
sudo yum -y upgrade

# install come useful packages
sudo yum -y install vim bash-completion wget

# remove the firewall
# this isn't recommended in production but is not required for a demo environment
sudo yum -y remove firewalld

#!/bin/sh

# download and extract the MySQL installation files
cd ~
wget http://dev.mysql.com/get/Downloads/MySQL-Cluster-7.4/MySQL-Cluster-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm-bundle.tar
tar -xvf MySQL-Cluster-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm-bundle.tar

# configure required packages and make sure no MariaDB packages are left installed
sudo yum -y install perl-Data-Dumper
sudo yum -y remove mariadb-libs

# install the required MySQL packages
# these are part of the .tar file downloaded earlier
cd ~
rpm -Uvh MySQL-Cluster-client-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm
rpm -Uvh MySQL-Cluster-server-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm
rpm -Uvh MySQL-Cluster-shared-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm

# create the MySQL directory structure
sudo mkdir -p /var/lib/mysql-cluster
cd /var/lib/mysql-cluster

# at this point the base VM is created and MySQL is installed but we haven't configured anything
# this will be done in a later step, after the SQL and data nodes have been deployed

action_list.name: action_create

action_list.description: System action for deleting an application. Deletes physical machines as well
action_list.name: action_delete

action_list.description: System action for starting an application

attrs.script:
# create the basic configuration file
echo "[ndb_mgmd default]
# Directory for MGM node log files
DataDir=/var/lib/mysql-cluster
 
[ndb_mgmd]
HostName=@@{address}@@
 
[ndbd default]
NoOfReplicas=@@{NUMBER_OF_REPLICAS}@@
DataMemory=256M
IndexMemory=128M

#Directory for Data Node
DataDir=/var/lib/mysql-cluster
" | sudo tee /var/lib/mysql-cluster/config.ini

# grab an array of IP addresses for the SQL nodes
sqlnodes=$(echo "@@{SQLNodeSubstrate.address}@@" | sed 's/^,//' | sed 's/,$//' | tr "," "\n")

# grab an array of IP addresses for the data nodes
datanodes=$(echo "@@{DataNodeSubstrate.address}@@" | sed 's/^,//' | sed 's/,$//' | tr "," "\n")

for datanode in $datanodes
do
   echo "[ndbd]
HostName=$datanode
# the following 2 lines can be required for large data imports
# for e.g. the 'employees' sample database available online
# set to a reasonable setting for your environment
#MaxNoOfConcurrentOperations=100000
#MaxNoOfLocalOperations=110000
" | sudo tee -a /var/lib/mysql-cluster/config.ini
done

for sqlnode in $sqlnodes
do
   echo "[mysqld]
HostName=$sqlnode
" | sudo tee -a /var/lib/mysql-cluster/config.ini
done

action_list.name: action_start

action_list.description: System action for stopping an application
action_list.name: action_stop

action_list.description: System action for restarting an application
action_list.name: action_restart

action_list.description: System action for deleting an application. Does not delete physical machines
action_list.name: action_soft_delete

action_list.description: System action for creating an application

attrs.script:
#!/bin/sh

# set the VM's hostname
sudo hostnamectl set-hostname @@{SQL_NODE_HOSTNAME}@@-@@{calm_array_index}@@

# make sure all packages are upgraded to the latest versions
sudo yum -y update
sudo yum -y upgrade

# install come useful packages
sudo yum -y install vim bash-completion wget

# remove the firewall
# this isn't recommended in production but is not required for a demo environment
sudo yum -y remove firewalld

#!/bin/sh

# download and extract the MySQL installation files
cd ~
wget http://dev.mysql.com/get/Downloads/MySQL-Cluster-7.4/MySQL-Cluster-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm-bundle.tar
tar -xvf MySQL-Cluster-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm-bundle.tar

# configure required packages and make sure no MariaDB packages are left installed
sudo yum -y install perl-Data-Dumper
sudo yum -y remove mariadb-libs

# install the required MySQL packages
# these are part of the .tar file downloaded earlier
cd ~
rpm -Uvh MySQL-Cluster-client-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm
rpm -Uvh MySQL-Cluster-server-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm
rpm -Uvh MySQL-Cluster-shared-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm

echo "[mysqld]
ndbcluster
ndb-connectstring=@@{Management.address}@@
default_storage_engine=ndbcluster
 
[mysql_cluster]
ndb-connectstring=@@{Management.address}@@" | sudo tee /etc/my.cnf

attrs.script:
#!/bin/sh

# set the VM's hostname
sudo hostnamectl set-hostname @@{PROXYSQL_HOSTNAME}@@-@@{calm_array_index}@@

# make sure all packages are upgraded to the latest versions
sudo yum -y update
sudo yum -y upgrade

# install come useful packages
sudo yum -y install vim bash-completion wget

# remove the firewall
# this isn't recommended in production but is not required for a demo environment
sudo yum -y remove firewalld

#!/bin/sh

# install the Percona repository, required for ProxySQL install
sudo yum -y install http://www.percona.com/downloads/percona-release/redhat/0.1-4/percona-release-0.1-4.noarch.rpm
sudo yum -y update

# install ProxySQL
sudo yum -y install proxysql

# start ProxySQL
sudo service proxysql start

# install the MySQL client binaries
sudo yum -y install mysql-client

attrs.script:
#!/bin/sh

# set the VM's hostname
sudo hostnamectl set-hostname @@{MANAGEMENT_HOSTNAME}@@

# make sure all packages are upgraded to the latest versions
sudo yum -y update
sudo yum -y upgrade

# install come useful packages
sudo yum -y install vim bash-completion wget

# remove the firewall
# this isn't recommended in production but is not required for a demo environment
sudo yum -y remove firewalld

#!/bin/sh

# download and extract the MySQL installation files
cd ~
wget http://dev.mysql.com/get/Downloads/MySQL-Cluster-7.4/MySQL-Cluster-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm-bundle.tar
tar -xvf MySQL-Cluster-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm-bundle.tar

# configure required packages and make sure no MariaDB packages are left installed
sudo yum -y install perl-Data-Dumper
sudo yum -y remove mariadb-libs

# install the required MySQL packages
# these are part of the .tar file downloaded earlier
cd ~
rpm -Uvh MySQL-Cluster-client-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm
rpm -Uvh MySQL-Cluster-server-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm
rpm -Uvh MySQL-Cluster-shared-gpl-7.4.10-1.el7.x86_64.rpm

# create the MySQL directory structure
sudo mkdir -p /var/lib/mysql-cluster
cd /var/lib/mysql-cluster

# at this point the base VM is created and MySQL is installed but we haven't configured anything
# this will be done in a later step, after the SQL and data nodes have been deployed

# create the basic configuration file
echo "[ndb_mgmd default]
# Directory for MGM node log files
DataDir=/var/lib/mysql-cluster
 
[ndb_mgmd]
HostName=@@{address}@@
 
[ndbd default]
NoOfReplicas=@@{NUMBER_OF_REPLICAS}@@
DataMemory=256M
IndexMemory=128M

#Directory for Data Node
DataDir=/var/lib/mysql-cluster
" | sudo tee /var/lib/mysql-cluster/config.ini

# grab an array of IP addresses for the SQL nodes
sqlnodes=$(echo "@@{SQLNodeSubstrate.address}@@" | sed 's/^,//' | sed 's/,$//' | tr "," "\n")

# grab an array of IP addresses for the data nodes
datanodes=$(echo "@@{DataNodeSubstrate.address}@@" | sed 's/^,//' | sed 's/,$//' | tr "," "\n")

for datanode in $datanodes
do
   echo "[ndbd]
HostName=$datanode
# the following 2 lines can be required for large data imports
# for e.g. the 'employees' sample database available online
# set to a reasonable setting for your environment
#MaxNoOfConcurrentOperations=100000
#MaxNoOfLocalOperations=110000
" | sudo tee -a /var/lib/mysql-cluster/config.ini
done

for sqlnode in $sqlnodes
do
   echo "[mysqld]
HostName=$sqlnode
" | sudo tee -a /var/lib/mysql-cluster/config.ini
done
